content.question:
Step 1: 

<math alttext="H 2 O 2 plus I with a negative 1 charge produces I O with a negative 1 charge plus H 2 O" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>IO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 

Step 2: 

<math alttext="H 2 O 2 plus I O with a negative 1 charge produces H 2 O plus O 2 plus I with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>IO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> 

The mechanism for a chemical reaction is shown above. Which of the following statements about the overall reaction and rate laws of the elementary reactions is correct?

choices.label: The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 H 2 O 2 plus I with a negative 1 charge produces 2 H 2 O plus O 2 plus I with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext> </mtext><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext> </mtext><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law for elementary step 2 is <math alttext="rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H 2 O 2 times the molar concentration of I O with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>IO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="H 2 O 2 plus I O with a negative 1 charge produces H 2 O plus O 2 plus I with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>IO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mo>→</mo><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law for elementary step 2 is <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H 2 O 2 squared, times the molar concentration of I O with a negative 1 charge " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mtext>[</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>IO</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 H 2 O 2 produces 2 H 2 O plus O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law for elementary step 1 is <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration H 2 O 2, times the molar concentration of I with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 H 2 O 2 produces 2 H 2 O plus O 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law for elementary step 1 is <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration of H 2 O 2 squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msup><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>]</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The chemical equation for the overall reaction is <math alttext="2 H 2 O 2 produces 2 H 2 O plus O 2 " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mo>→</mo><mn>2</mn><mtext> </mtext><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>O</mtext><mo>+</mo><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the rate law for elementary step 1 is <math alttext="Rate equals k, times the molar concentration H 2 O 2, times the molar concentration of I with a negative 1 charge" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mi>t</mi><mi>e</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>k</mi><msub><mrow><mtext>[</mtext><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><msub><mrow><mtext>O</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>][</mtext><msup><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo></mrow></msup><mtext>]</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 5.E: Determine a balanced chemical equation for a given chemical phenomenon.
